page.title: 02FARMER'S DAY (HILL FARM)
page.content: The tasks{Mr. Wright}starts after breakfast at{Hill Farm,}vary each day according to the season and the weather on his{arable 200 acre farm. In the middle of the morning Mr. Wright stops work to eat his '{BAGIN}' -This is a local word for the {mid-morning snack}(the farmer having carried his flask of tea & sandwiches out to the fields with him). At lunch time, it is back to the farm house where his wife has prepared a{hot lunch}- he hopes it is his favourite meal of steak and mushrooms with onions, peas and chips. After lunch, the farmer goes out to the fields again until tea-time. Work outside will continue until{very late during the{Summer months.
